name: tram track construction | tram track | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4371/documentation

Based on 'tram track construction, CH 2000'. Inventory  for double track concrete stretch (width = 6.5m) and a bitumen layer of 3 cm on top. Alternative constructions of tram-infrastructure (e.g. green stretches) are not accounted for. The life span is estimated at 15 years. The disposal of tram track is included. The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions represents the operation and maintenance of one tram track. The dataset is limited to the energy consumption and land use.

The datasets starts with the material consumption (concrete, bitumen and gravel). The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions starts with the electricity consumption for signals.

The inventory includes processes for the supply of construction materials such as gravel, bitumen and concrete. In addition, steel expenditures for railway tracks and bracing are included. NMVOC emissions from bitumen are included. Also transport of materials to the constructions site has been taken into account. The disposal is included. The inventory of the energy use and combustion emissions includes energy consumption for signals. Furthermore, land occupation and transformation are included. The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions ends with the operation and maintenance of one tram track. The dataset includes the electricity consumption and until and including the land use (land occupation and transformation). The dataset does not include the material consumption for the operation and maintenance.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/421:Construction of roads and railways/4210:Construction of roads and railways

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Tramway length is based on current statistical data (2000). The material consumption represents a situation in the early 1990ties. For the energy use and combustion emissions, the tram track length is based on current statistical data (2000).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from 'tram track construction, CH 2000'. Data refers to average conditions in Switzerland. The data of the energy use and combustion emissions refers to average conditions in Switzerland. For de icing activities, a recent Austrian has been applied.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Swiss state of the art technology. The inventory of the energy use and combustion emissions for operation and maintenance of tram infrastructure is limited to the energy consumption for signals (79.5 kWh/m*a) and land use. For the operation of signals a electricity consumption of 79.5 kWh/m*a is accounted for Maibach et al. (1999). ;;References:;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. ;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: none This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
